content.description: Make a dynamic move to the first bolt. There is a dynamic crux at the second bolt (a difficult clip), and then it is easier climbing to the top.
content.protection: Three bolts to chain anchors with fixed 'biners.
content.location: This is the center route on the wall on the edge of the dropoff down to the river.

content.description: Hantavirus is bouldery goodness through a small roof to a sloper rail. Think with your heels.
content.protection: Four bolts to chain anchors with fixed 'biners.
content.location: It is the leftmost route on the wall.

content.description: A crimpy crux off the ground leads to two more boulder problems separated by decent rests. This is fun, sustained climbing from the river level. Lower off to the upper tier.
content.protection: Five bolts to chain anchors with fixed 'biners.
content.location: This is the rightmost route on the wall. Begin at river level (sometimes flooded in early spring).

content.description: Layback big holds to start. High step the crux after the 2nd bolt, and finish with continuous, engaging movement to the anchors.
content.protection: 7 bolts and a rappel anchor at the top.
content.location: Locate a low first bolt on the furthest to the right of the 3 routes above the creek.

content.description: Stickclip a high first bolt. Move up and left from the start on big holds. Climb a moderate face to a 4' horizontal roof. Climb the crux on big holds pulling the roof.
content.location: It is the furthest left of the 3 sport routes directly above Coal Creek.

content.description: Stickclip the first bolt, and make big moves off the ground. Undercling the crux through the 2nd bolt. Finish with fun climbing in a small corner and through a little roof to the anchors.
content.location: It is the middle of the three sport routes directly above Coal Creek.
